[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I went to another martial arts class and had a blast.
That's great, were there a lot of students today? I've been at home working on a project.
Quite a few, but it wasn't too crowded. It was a nice change of scenery. What kind of project are you working on?
I'm sure the student appreciate that. You teach as a group as apposed to one-on-one right? And one of the companies I work for had their system hit with a virus so I've been upgraded their software to debug the system.
I teach group classes and one on one, but I was the student today. I specialize in jiu-jitsu but today I got to be the student in a taekwondo class.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Introduction and Personal Interests', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B discuss their personal interests, including work, hobbies, and classes they are taking.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Hello! How are you doing tonight? ### Speaker B: I am fine I am just working from home on some software solutions you? ### Speaker A: Not too good. Regretting eating ice cream just now. ###. ### Speaker B: Oh no! I love ice cream the best is here in america. ### Speaker A: What kind of work do you do? I teach jiu-jitsu! ### Speaker B: Cool job. I am a software tech from england.. ### Speaker A: I am also a college student. Im going to be takin summer courses soon :|. ### Speaker B: Good for you! I like to run a lot. I run marathons half ones. ### Speaker A: Sounds like something I would love. I am very active- I love martial arts! ### Speaker B: I took classes when I first came to the us in 2004.' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Favorite Restaurants and Teaching Martial Arts', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B share their favorite restaurants and discuss their love for teaching and learning martial arts.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Ahh my favorite restaurant is Taco Bell! A little less fancy lol. ### Speaker B: Oh wow, we really went there okay lol. I'm sure you have to jiu-jitsu the calories off haha. How has the martial arts teaching been? ### Speaker A: I love teaching! I also love learning and it's so much fun being a teacher and a student! ### Speaker B: I'm glad to hear! I recently signed up for a class which teaches the history of martial arts. It's online and its pretty fun and laidback.' }
```
